column4: hi all, i have installed Ubuntu on external HDD but now i can't run it, my BIOS don't have option to boot from USB :[ what can i do?
try a bios update, you wont be able to boot from usb if your bios doesnt support it
you could boot from floppy disk to bootstrap the usb to boot
i don't want to use floppy disk :C i'll try to update my BIOS
if you cant boot from bios, ten you'll have to
its just to load the bootloader, aftr that its usb drive all the way
ya, but will i have to do this every time?
not all boards support usb booting
ya, my laptop is old one :}
they may have kicked out a bios that does, if not its floppy for you
okay, but first i'll try to upgrade my bios and if that did't work i'll use the fdd
make sure its the right bios or your system will never boot
